Guideline: Use state management for complex apps

Code Good: Extract widget to method or class

Don't: ListView with children for large lists

Description: Android back behavior and predictive back (Android 14+)
Dart 3.0 records for immutable lightweight data
Do: Use records for simple data grouping
Don't: Create full classes for simple tuples
Code Good: final (name, age) = ('John', 30); typedef User = (String name, int age);
Code Bad: class SimpleData { String a; int b; } // for tuples

Description: Sealed classes enable exhaustive pattern matching
Do: sealed class for finite state hierarchies
Code Good: sealed class Result {} class Success extends Result { final String data; } switch (result) { Success() => ... }

Description: Dart 3.0 pattern matching for concise logic

Don't: Manual provider declarations in large apps
Code Good: @riverpod Future<User> user(UserRef ref) async { return await fetchUser(); }

Description: Hooks pattern for cleaner StatefulWidget logic
Code Good: final controller = useTextEditingController(); final animation = useAnimationController(duration: Duration(seconds: 1));
// Enabled by default in Flutter 3.16+ // Precompiled shaders eliminate jank
Code Bad: // Skia shader compilation jank on first run

Description: M3 design system with dynamic theming
Code Good: MaterialApp(theme: ThemeData(useMaterial3: true, colorScheme: ColorScheme.fromSeed(seedColor: Colors.blue)))

Description: CustomScrollView with Slivers for complex scrolling

Don't: Manual route management in large apps

Code Good: PopScope(canPop: false, onPopInvokedWithResult: (didPop, result) { if (!didPop) handleBack(); })

Don't: Assume mobile patterns work on web
Code Good: if (kIsWeb) { // web-specific } import 'heavy.dart' deferred as heavy;
Code Bad: // Same code for mobile and web without checks

Description: Keyboard shortcuts hover states scroll physics

Guideline: Use golden tests for visual regression

Don't: Basic integration_test only for complex apps

Code Bad: lib/screens/ lib/widgets/ lib/services/ // hard to scale

Description: Separation of data domain presentation layers
Code Good: class UserRepository { Future<User> getUser(); } // injected via Riverpod

Description: Impeller eliminates shader compilation jank with precompiled shaders
Do: Enable Impeller and design for 60+ FPS consistency
Don't: Rely on Skia shader warmup workarounds
Code Good: // flutter run --enable-impeller // Default in Flutter 3.19+ ensures smooth first-frame animations
Code Bad: // Skia: ShaderWarmUp class for precompilation workarounds

Description: Use DevTools Timeline for Impeller performance analysis
Do: Monitor frame times and GPU utilization in DevTools
Don't: Assume Impeller fixes all performance issues
Code Good: // DevTools > Performance > Enable Impeller metrics // Check for consistent 16ms frame budget
Code Bad: // No profiling relying on visual smoothness only

Description: Impeller default on iOS enable explicitly on Android
Don't: Assume same rendering on all platforms
Code Good: // iOS: Impeller default // Android: flutter run --enable-impeller or AndroidManifest.xml <meta-data android:name='io.flutter.embedding.android.EnableImpeller' android:value='true' />

Do: SpringSimulation with SpringDescription for organic feel
Don't: Linear or eased animations for interactive elements
Code Good: final spring = SpringSimulation(SpringDescription(mass: 1.0, stiffness: 500.0, damping: 25.0), 0, 1, 0); controller.animateWith(spring);

Description: mass stiffness damping control spring behavior
Do: Adjust stiffness (100-1000) and damping ratio for feel
Code Good: SpringDescription(mass: 1.0, stiffness: 400.0, damping: 20.0) // Bouncy SpringDescription.withDampingRatio(mass: 1.0, stiffness: 500.0, ratio: 0.7) // Smooth

Description: Connect drag gestures to spring animations
Code Good: onPanEnd: (details) { final velocity = details.velocity.pixelsPerSecond.dy; controller.animateWith(SpringSimulation(spring, currentValue, targetValue, velocity / 1000)); }
class SpringScrollPhysics extends ScrollPhysics { @override SpringDescription get spring => SpringDescription(mass: 0.5, stiffness: 100, damping: 1); }

Description: Design animations for high refresh rate screens
Do: Use TickerMode and vsync for 120Hz frame pacing
Code Good: // AnimationController respects display refresh rate // Profile on 120Hz devices for smoothness class _State extends State<X> with TickerProviderStateMixin

Description: Detect and adapt to display refresh rate
Do: Query refresh rate and adjust animation curves
Code Bad: // Assume 16ms frame budget on all devices

Guideline: Profile on high refresh rate devices
Do: Use DevTools to verify consistent frame delivery
Code Good: // DevTools Performance tab // Frame rendering time should be < 8.3ms for 120Hz // Check for jank spikes on ProMotion displays

Description: Rive state machines enable reactive vector animations
Do: rive package for complex state-driven animations
Don't: Lottie for interactive animations requiring state

Description: Trigger state changes from Flutter code
Do: SMITrigger SMIBool SMINumber for state control
Code Good: final trigger = _controller.findInput<bool>('isPressed') as SMIBool; trigger.value = true; // Triggers state transition

Don't: Load Rive files on every rebuild
Code Good: final riveFile = await RiveFile.asset('assets/anim.riv'); // Cache in state @override void initState() { _loadRive(); }
Code Bad: RiveAnimation.asset() in build() // Reloads each build

Guideline: Adapt to iOS 26 Liquid Glass design
Description: Cupertino widgets support Liquid Glass glassmorphism
Do: CupertinoTheme with translucent materials for iOS 26
Code Bad: // Opaque backgrounds ignoring Liquid Glass aesthetic

Do: BackdropFilter with ImageFilter.blur for glass effect

Description: Large title navigation adapting to Liquid Glass
Material 3 emphasized easing for natural motion
Don't: Linear or basic easing for UI animations

Code Good: AnimatedPadding(duration: Duration(ms: 300), padding: EdgeInsets.all(isExpanded ? 16 : 8), child: content)

Don't: Rebuilding entire widget tree on animation tick
Code Good: AnimatedBuilder(animation: controller, builder: (context, child) => Transform.rotate(angle: controller.value * 2 * pi, child: child), child: const Icon(Icons.refresh))
Code Bad: setState on every animation tick // Rebuilds entire tree

Do: Staggered intervals for list item animations
Code Good: Interval(index * 0.1, index * 0.1 + 0.5, curve: Curves.easeOut) // Stagger each item

Description: Reduce animation work when battery is low
Do: Check battery state and reduce animation complexity
Don't: Full animations regardless of battery state
Code Good: if (await Battery().batteryLevel < 20) { animationDuration = Duration.zero; } // Reduce motion on low battery
if (MediaQuery.of(context).disableAnimations) { return child; // Skip animation } return AnimatedWidget(child: child);
